import React,{useState, useEffect} from 'react' import axios from "axios"; function Weather() { const [city, setCity] = useState("kolkata") const [data, setdata] = useState(initialState) const getWeatherInfo = () => { axios( { url: `https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?q=${city}&units=metric&appid=8881252aad8ef0d26bf595951220c34e`, method: 'GET', headers : { 'Content-Type':'application/json' } } ).then( response => { data = response.data; const {temp, humidity, pressure } = data.main; const {main: weatherMood} = data.weather[0]; const {name} = data; const {speed} = data.wind; const {country, sunset} = data.sys; } ).catch((error) => {console.log(error)}) } useEffect(() => { getWeatherInfo(); },) return ( <>
{setCity(e.target.value)}} />
25.25°
Sunny
Pune, India
{new Date().toLocaleString() }

19:19 PM

) } export default Weather;
